DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this research study is to investigate how nurses can best help people with serious mental illnesses (SMI) follow their HIV treatment plans.
DOC.brief_title: Nursing Intervention for HIV Regime Adherence Among People With Serious Mental Illness (SMI)
DOC.detailed_description: There is concern that HIV positive SMI persons may be a greater risk for poor treatment adherence, increasing risk for poorer outcomes and development of treatment resistance virus, and also placing others at greater risk. Involvement of advance practice nurses has been previously shown to improve outcomes for persons with HIV/AIDS.
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis of serious mental illness; HIV positive
